definitions.definition: Any type of sword that is comparatively long; depending on context, applied to swords of the Bronze Age, Migration period, Viking Age and Renaissance era.
A European sword with a long, straight double-edged blade , a cruciform hilt , and a grip for two-handed use; prevalent from the 14th to 16th centuries.

main_definition: Any type of sword that is comparatively long; depending on context, applied to swords of the Bronze Age, Migration period, Viking Age and Renaissance era.
secondary_definitions: A European sword with a long, straight double-edged blade , a cruciform hilt , and a grip for two-handed use; prevalent from the 14th to 16th centuries.
